artist: Ross Braught; Author: Publius Ovidius Naso, called Ovid; Translator: Joseph Addison; Translator: John Dryden; Publisher: Ross Braught
dimension: 14 1/8 x 11 1/4 x 3/4 in. (35.88 x 28.58 x 1.91 cm) (book only, closed)
image_copyright: Copyright of the artist, artist's estate, or assignees
provenance: Kathryn C. Johnson, Minneapolis; given to MIA, 2004.
signed: on colophon page, in black ink: Ross Braught
text: The South Dakota Badlands and Grand Canyon inspired the look of Ross Braught's lithographic book Phaethon, based on the Roman poet Ovid's Metamorphoses. For Braught, mythic power lies in the landscape, where trees, waters and hills surge with the energy of the female form.
title: Phaethon
